title: Strictly’s Will Bayley leaves Motsi Mabuse in tears after emotional dance
text:
Will Bayley leaves Motsi Mabuse in tears (Picture: BBC)

Will Bayley left judges Motsi Mabuse and Alfonso Ribeiro in tears on Strictly Come Dancing after performing a very personal routine.

The 31-year-old table tennis player, who won gold at the Rio 2016 Paralympics, was born with arthrogryposis – a condition which causes curved joints affecting all four of his limbs.

He was later diagnosed with non-Hodgkin lymphoma, a rare form of cancer, aged seven, and was treated at Great Ormond Street Children’s hospital who helped him through rehabilitation.

Dancing Contemporary with partner Janette Manrara to 7 Years by Lukas Graham, Will dedicated his dance to all those at the hospital.

The emotional performance prompted an outpouring of emotions from the judges, with stand-in judge Alfonso Ribeiro left teary before giving his critique.

‘You gave me chills,’ Alfonso said. ‘That was incredibly inspiring.

‘There are young boys and girls who watch that performance and know that anything is possible.’

Motsi Mabuse was also left in tears following the performance, with Will giving her a hug after being rendered speechless.

Will Bayley gave Motsi Mabuse a hug (Picture: BBC)

Alfonso Ribeiro on Strictly was left emotional by the performance (Picture: BBC)

Giving her critique, Shirley Ballas said: ‘Well this is you. You came out here, you shared your journey and I’m sure every child in every children’s hospital is looking at that today and has discovered that no matter what you put your mind to you can do it under extreme circumstances.

‘You are inspiring, you give the whole nation hope, and I just thought it was a great number wonderfully executed.’

Will’s dance earned him his highest score yet, earning 7, 8, 8, 9 for a total score of 32 points.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Sunday on BBC One.
